pageContext.description: Piece of blade near cutting edge. Edge itself missing. The whole is slightly curved and on the concave side is a large casting flaw, around which the metal is very thin. Remains of wood in socket.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard; see card for first socketed celt.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Jessup, Arch of Kent, 107,Evans,Journ. Anhtop. Inst. III, 230.
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on line of railway cutting, 6 feet below surface, lying on stratum of sand c. 25 yards NE by N of summit of hill. Found June 4, 1872.
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
